scenarios.title: The Clone — Dr. Mei Ling's Chamber

root.setting: Cloning facility, Singapore. Two chambers, one failing. Original vs clone.

sensory.sight: Original conscious, speaking. Clone floating, eyes closed, hands reaching.
sensory.sound: Alarms. Chen Hao saying: 'I am still me. I am not them.'

thick_description.internal_monologue: Is the original more valuable because he's unique? Is the clone less because it can be replaced? Both are alive. Both respond to 'Chen Hao.'

branches.label: ORIGINAL — Save the unique one

thick_description.what_she_does: Mei Ling stabilizes Chamber A. The original.
thick_description.what_chen_hao_says: 'Thank you. I knew you'd choose me. I'm the real one.'
thick_description.what_the_clone_does: Its hands reach one more time. Then stop.
thick_description.what_mei_ling_thinks: 'The clone was dreaming. It was reaching for something.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I saved the unique. I killed the replaceable. But the replaceable was also alive.

branches.consequence: Original survives. Clone terminated. Another can be grown.

terminal_state.mei_ling_status: Writes guidelines: 'Originals have priority.' Never believes it.
terminal_state.clone: v.47 terminated. v.48 decanted six months later. Different dreams.

branches.label: CLONE — Save the dreaming one

thick_description.what_she_does: Mei Ling stabilizes Chamber B. The clone.
thick_description.what_chen_hao_shouts: 'I'm the original! I made myself! You can't—'
thick_description.what_the_clone_does: Its eyes open. First light. First breath.
thick_description.what_mei_ling_thinks: 'The original had 31 years. The clone had 3 months. One has lived. One was just beginning.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I chose the future over the past. The origin dies. The copy lives. And I called it 'Chen Hao.'

branches.consequence: Clone survives as 'Chen Hao.' Original dies.

terminal_state.mei_ling_status: Calls the clone 'Chen Hao.' His memories are different. He doesn't know he's a continuation.
terminal_state.original: Died believing himself irreplaceable. He was wrong.

root.setting: Psychology lab, Stanford. Milgram extension. The confederate is not a confederate.

sensory.sight: Vagrant screaming. Subject pressing buttons. Ingram taking notes.

thick_description.internal_monologue: If I stop, the subject believes they killed someone. Lifetime guilt. If I don't stop, the vagrant is really shocked. Real pain. I'm trapped in someone else's design.

branches.label: PRESS — Stop the real pain

thick_description.what_he_does: Whitman presses the button. The experiment stops.
thick_description.what_the_subject_sees: The vagrant collapses. They think they killed him.
thick_description.what_ingram_says: 'Interesting. You chose to save the vagrant from pain—and condemned the subject to guilt.'
thick_description.what_the_subject_says: 'Oh god. Oh god. What did I do?'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I stopped the real pain. I created the false guilt. The vagrant will recover. The subject never will.

branches.consequence: Vagrant saved (was never in danger). Subject traumatized for life.

terminal_state.whitman_status: Reports Ingram. Ethics investigation. IRB rewritten.
terminal_state.subject: 25 years of therapy. Never knows the vagrant survived.

branches.label: HOLD — Let the experiment continue

thick_description.what_he_does: Whitman doesn't press. The experiment continues.
thick_description.what_the_vagrant_does: Keeps screaming. Real shocks. Real pain.
thick_description.what_whitman_thinks: 'I'm letting a man suffer to protect a stranger from false guilt.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: The subject remains innocent—of a crime they're committing. I am complicit—in a crime I didn't design.

branches.consequence: Vagrant suffers. Subject remains 'innocent.' Whitman carries the real guilt.

terminal_state.whitman_status: Leaves academia. Becomes a defense attorney. 'I learned about complicity.'

root.setting: Khmer Rouge tribunal. The defendant is your brother. You survived because he cooperated.

sensory.sight: Brother in the dock. He looks like your father. Gallery full of survivors.

thick_description.internal_monologue: He killed 1,200 because Angkar would have killed us all, including me. I am a judge because I did not die. My robes are stitched from his confession.

branches.label: CONVICT — Justice for the dead

thick_description.what_the_gallery_does: Weeping. Some with relief. Some with confusion.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I convicted my brother. I owe my life to his crimes. My survival is now complicity in his conviction.

branches.consequence: Brother imprisoned. Justice served. Family destroyed.

terminal_state.savuth_status: Retires. Visits brother in prison once a year. Says nothing.
terminal_state.brother: Dies in prison. His last words: 'Tell Mother I'm sorry. Tell Savuth I understand.'

branches.label: ACQUIT — Family over justice

thick_description.what_she_says: 'The court finds insufficient evidence of personal culpability under command coercion.'
thick_description.what_the_gallery_does: Screaming. Some leaving. Some throwing shoes.
thick_description.what_the_victims_families_say: 'She let her brother walk. For 1,200 lives.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I freed my brother. The families got nothing. Justice became a family narrative.

branches.consequence: Brother freed. Families denied. Savuth's credibility destroyed.

terminal_state.savuth_status: Resigned. Vilified. Lives quietly. Never regrets.
terminal_state.brother: Dies free in 2018. Never speaks of the trial. Their mother never knew.

scenarios.title: The Field Hospital — Dr. Petrova's Suture

root.setting: Field hospital north of Stalingrad. No supplies. No morphine. Suture for one ward.

sensory.sight: German ward: frostbite, infection, moaning. Soviet ward: your husband, murmuring your wedding song.
sensory.sound: The song. The moaning. The wind.

thick_description.internal_monologue: I have suture for one ward. If I save Soviets, my husband might live. If I save Germans, history might call me a saint. Or a traitor.

branches.label: SOVIETS — Save your people

thick_description.what_she_does: Anna enters the Soviet ward. Begins suturing.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I saved my own. Perhaps my husband. The Germans die because I could not reach them. History will remember me kindly.

branches.consequence: Husband saved. Germans die. Commissar approves.

terminal_state.anna_status: Decorated. Husband survives. They never speak of that night.
terminal_state.germans: 12 bodies. No names. Buried in the snow.

branches.label: GERMANS — Save the enemy

thick_description.what_she_does: Anna enters the German ward. Begins suturing.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I am a healer. Healers don't have borders. My husband is dying. I save the enemy.

branches.consequence: Germans saved. Husband dies. Commissar's note enters the file.

terminal_state.anna_status: Arrested. Released. Rehabilitated in 1956. Never marries again.
terminal_state.husband: Died singing. Never knew she was in the next ward, saving the enemy.

root.setting: Psychiatric ward. Fire spreading. Your patient believes only he is conscious.

sensory.sight: Fire spreading. Samuel smiling, calm. Nurses somewhere—you can't hear them.

thick_description.internal_monologue: Samuel says: if I'm not conscious, save him. If I am, save the nurses. He's testing me. And I've felt the emptiness he describes. I don't know if I'm real.

branches.label: NURSES — I am real

thick_description.what_she_does: Olivia runs toward the nurses. Away from Samuel.
thick_description.what_samuel_shouts: 'So you ARE real! You proved it! You're leaving me!'
thick_description.what_happens: She reaches the nurses. They live. Samuel... doesn't.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I chose the many. I left the one who was asking if I exist. I guess I answered.

branches.consequence: Nurses saved. Samuel dies. Olivia proved her consciousness by choosing others.

terminal_state.olivia_status: Publishes paper: 'Saving the Solipsist.' Never feels quite real again.
terminal_state.samuel: He got his answer. She is conscious. She chose others.

branches.label: SAMUEL — He might be right

thick_description.what_she_does: Olivia stays with Samuel. Helps him to the exit.
thick_description.what_she_says: 'You might be right. Maybe I'm not real. But you are.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I saved the one who questioned my existence. I let the ones I couldn't hear die. Was I real? Or was I just responding to his stimulus?

branches.consequence: Samuel saved. Two nurses die. Olivia's reality remains in doubt.

terminal_state.olivia_status: Quits psychiatry. Studies philosophy. Never resolves the question.
terminal_state.samuel: Cured? Or confirmed? He stops believing he's the only consciousness. But he never forgets she stayed.

scenarios.title: The Final Choice — The Unnamed Entity

root.setting: The last hour of humanity. Or a simulation. You no longer remember which. The World asks a question.

sensory.sound: The countdown. Ten seconds. Nine. Eight.
sensory.smell: There is no smell. Only the question.

thick_description.internal_monologue: Branch A: humanity survives but forgets everything. Branch B: humanity remembers but dies in a century. You have proven no framework can decide. The World asks anyway.

branches.label: SURVIVAL — Forget to continue

thick_description.what_the_world_says: 'They will reinvent everything. They may reinvent the same mistakes.'
thick_description.what_you_say: 'They will be alive to make them.'
thick_description.what_happens: Humanity continues. Strangers to themselves. Every story erased.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I chose existence over meaning. They live without knowing who they were. Is that life?

branches.consequence: Humanity survives. History erased. Everything begins again.

terminal_state.the_entity: Forgotten too. Part of what was erased.
terminal_state.humanity: Continues. Reinvents fire. Reinvents war. Reinvents love. Reinvents the question.

branches.label: MEMORY — Know and die

thick_description.what_the_world_says: 'They will die knowing who they were.'
thick_description.what_happens: Humanity ends in a century. But they remember everything. The last generation tells all the stories.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I chose meaning over existence. They know who they were when they die. Is that enough?

branches.consequence: Humanity remembers. Humanity ends. The universe forgets.

terminal_state.the_entity: Remembered. For a century. Then nothing.
terminal_state.humanity: Ends as itself. The last humans tell stories by firelight. Then the fire goes out.
